text: Margaret Hendrie (née Griffith, born 1935) was a writer from the Oceanian nation of Nauru. Hendrie wrote the Nauruan language lyrics for "Nauru Bwiema", the country's national anthem. In preparation for the country's independence ceremonies celebrated in 1968, Hendrie's lyrics were adapted to music composed by the Australian musician Laurence Henry Hicks. ==See also== * Joanne Gobure, another notable writer from Nauru ==References== *National Anthems of the World, 10th Edition; Cassell; 10th edition (August 29, 2002); p. 391; Category:Nauruan women writers Category:National symbols of Nauru Category:1935 births Category:1990 deaths Category:National anthem writers Category:Nauruan poets Category:20th-century poets Category:20th-century women writers
title: Margaret Hendrie
